title: ProRep
motivation: I felt like doing a project that was cool and entertaining.
fun: Ease-of-use of the create-react-app node package and Webpack, a new tool I hadn't used before. Also, inline SVG's and the fact that they can be manipulated through CSS.
pain: Writing the React component for a custom range slider (with two sliders in this case)  took days, and a surprising amount of custom code for a seemingly simple web component.

title: BikeCouch
motivation: A hiatus-summer and a very appropriately tailored Google News Feed. I had tried Apache Cordova on a student project before, and was left with rather mixed feelings. On top of that, I wanted to get some experience with (quasi) native mobile development. The Flutter SDK was a natural pick - as the newest kid on the block - and was a pleasure to work in from the get-go and its more wide-spread adoption is something to look forward to!
technologies: Flutter SDK, Firebase/Firestore, Google Vision API
fun: Whipping up an app in mere days!
pain: At the time of development, the documentation and community support of Flutter was not great.

title: Lexical Schema Matcher
motivation: This is the coding part of my Hnrs. Computer Science & Physics degree, completed during my last year in college. The title sounds ominous, but Open Data is something I didn't know existed, and while I was working on this project, grew to something that I hope I supported by writing about it.
technologies: Node.js, Cheerio (Web Crawling), Research Paper Thingy
pain: Gists are unnecessarily hard to embed in React.js.

title: Project 4
pain: Gists are unnecessarily hard to embed in React.js.
